meanings.definition: A substance containing no medication and prescribed or given to reinforce a patient's expectation to get well.
meanings.sent1: The doctor gave the patient a placebo to make them feel better.
meanings.sent2: She took a placebo pill every day as part of the clinical trial.
meanings.sent3: The placebo looked like a real pill, but it was just a trick.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude acted as a placebo, boosting his recovery.
meanings.sent5: The placebo effect can sometimes be surprisingly powerful.

meanings.sent4: Her belief in the placebo was so strong, it actually worked.
